text: hey <!channel> - trying to do some Compass/ Library housekeeping - all of the visual design boards are leaning against the wall in the social space. When you have a chance, can you strip the boards that you don’t need to keep? It’s getting pretty crowded in there and I want to minimize the number of boards. Thank you!
YES. i can lead this charge!
partly because i feel guilty about it
thank you!

<@U0HP6TFNX|megan> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/megan/F13KJGAVB/pasted_image_at_2016_04_25_03_15_pm.png|activity tracking / auto-suggestions> and commented: Just want to share an idea now, so you all can also have it in your heads. I’m working on auto-suggested activities (e.g. when I go to this neighborhood, I might have done yoga) similar to how foursquare suggests places you might have been

initial_comment.comment: Just want to share an idea now, so you all can also have it in your heads. I’m working on auto-suggested activities (e.g. when I go to this neighborhood, I might have done yoga) similar to how foursquare suggests places you might have been

text: Working on ideas for having ghosted activities suggested in the daily visualization. And thinking about how the visualization might be interactive. Like what happens if you drag your finger over the small circles. Just thoughts right now. Might play into the data viz and motion design happening concurrently.

I’ve actually been curious for awhile, does the UX team intend there to be any interaction with the individual hour circles? Currently the visualization tells you roughly whether it was a pretty active hour or not a very active hour by it’s relative size, is there any intention to dive into what data/activities went into making that particular hour what it is?

potentially, but I want to hold off to see what visualization we end up with. Last time we talked about it as a team, we were considering whether to keep / change the hour circles / trying to figure out other ways to visualize a day’s activity
thanks

As we think about the visualization, maybe the circle pattern doesn’t hold up in the end, but it could be interesting to run your finger over circles on the outside, and the outer circles grow a little to show what’s selected, and the inner circle reflects the data for that time period

I realized I never shared this concept with UX when it was made a couple months ago. I’m sure it’s far from where we’re going with this now but wanted to share in case it sparked any new ideas on how we’re laying this detail section stuff out.

<https://www.dropbox.com/s/y5834xsqvdqhoax/DashboardList_02.mov?dl=0>
nice

I like that concept. Reminds me of another project I worked on which never saw the light of day, but the motion & visualization of workout segments was a similar idea. Maybe also will spark new ideas: <http://pin.it/89vsIss>

attachments.title: Map pin motion
attachments.text: Map pin motion by Eric Atwell for Rally Interactive #UI #UX

text: follow the link for the animated version, the still doesn’t really show what I’m talking about
that’s great. i like the idea of a minimal list with a more elaborate magnifying highlight graphic for the selected list item.

<@U0260V1BX>, <@U0HP6TFNX> in regards to this "As we think about the visualization, maybe the circle pattern doesn’t hold up in the end” who is thinking about an alternative to the circle visualization?

Yeah that is really nice. The more I think about the “single, holistic visualization” vs separate visualizations of activity/sleep/discoveries… I think I’d rather have simpler visualizations with interesting interactivity than a single chart that encompasses everything… and then trying to add interactivity into the mix.
oh I just meant that I didn’t know if we had made final decisions

<@U026PLK4S> when we had that brainstorm with katrina I left under the impression that you guys were going to keep pushing on the circle but also potentially explore other ways of visualizing activity/sleep/discoveries.
so yeah, exactly what megan said - “whatever it ends up being"
sure, we had a brainstorm meeting. but we were all left kind of scratching our heads
then we got “final” wires that had it included. i think we’re still pushing some of that. actually, i know we are, just wanted to see if there was any concurrent movement on UX. if not, totally fine
the visualization in the wires is completely FPO
but agree, felix and i like the simplified single visualization wiht improved “switching”

also, is there anyway you could unpack the reasoning behind it being FPO a bit more? That visualization, among others, are high on our urgent hit-list for visual design. Would love to hear more about why you guys still think it’s FPO. Just so we can have something to judge new stuff against.

I just mean that the circle graph in the wires is placeholder for whatever visualization you guys come up with as THE one. It doesnt include sleep or discoveries and we discussed the need for including those elements if possible. On the UX front I have two versions of that screen wired out… one for a single, holistic visualization, one for separate treatment of activity, sleep, and discoveries.

<@U026PLK4S> <@U0HPGQ4KH> <@U0265G76F> To follow up on our conversation in the meeting, Melissa is going to chat with Elise and get her going on doing the audit of existing wires so she can create an inventory of where photos are needed in the app. She’ll also call out when there is specific intention for the photo need versus when it might be a photo, might not be, etc. Goal is to have it completed by end of week.
<@U0260V1BX>: totally. we’re on board with all of that. I’m curious what we’re looking for when we say THE one
don’t think we need the answer right now, but even as we compare the two options in the wireframes, it’d be good to know what we’re shooting for

<@U0260V1BX|melissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F13L82LKB/compass_home_25apr2016_detailview.pdf|Compass_Home_25Apr2016_DETAILVIEW.pdf> and commented: Here are my current wires for the detail view. The first couple pages outline the content/intentions of the day view and month view. Following those pages are the two options I mentioned. The solution may lie somewhere in between, who knows. Option A: The hero visualization shows just activity and workouts, there’s a separate visualization for sleep data, and discovery activities live at the bottom of the page. Option A Month view, same thing.  Option B: The visual team comes up with a successful visualization that incorporates activity, sleep (even high level) and discovery activities. Depending on what section you’re in, Activity, Sleep, or Discovery data will be “highlighted” in the visualization. Option B Month View: I dont know if this is even feasible, but is there a way to show activity and sleep (and discoveries?) in a single month visualization without having it be totally insane? If not, we can always go Option A for month view.

initial_comment.comment: Here are my current wires for the detail view. The first couple pages outline the content/intentions of the day view and month view. Following those pages are the two options I mentioned. The solution may lie somewhere in between, who knows. Option A: The hero visualization shows just activity and workouts, there’s a separate visualization for sleep data, and discovery activities live at the bottom of the page. Option A Month view, same thing.  Option B: The visual team comes up with a successful visualization that incorporates activity, sleep (even high level) and discovery activities. Depending on what section you’re in, Activity, Sleep, or Discovery data will be “highlighted” in the visualization. Option B Month View: I dont know if this is even feasible, but is there a way to show activity and sleep (and discoveries?) in a single month visualization without having it be totally insane? If not, we can always go Option A for month view.

text: of course i’m happy to chat through this more / answer questions if they come up

Right. We're good on all of this. Was just checking to see if there was concurrent UX work, knowing we made some progress together last time we all met for a brainstorm. If not, we'll keep on chuggin.

I was thinking about how the viz might show that there’s activity you might have done, but you haven’t confirmed it

text: which led me to think about how someone might interact the visual to see what was suggested
nothing else  on the UX side. I think it’s on the visual team to determine if this stuff can all fit into a single visualization or not, and the UX team will wire around it.
missed all this and i’d love to talk about it in person. tomorrow <http://please.be|please.be> 10:30?  Have a great eve.
Yep, good idea. Talk in the am.
Just catching up on this as well. Not sure I follow all of above. Will do my best to meet up in morning, though I have brandlab client here concurrently.
